text: Bernard Wasserstein is a British-American historian. He was born on January 22 1948 in London. He was a professor at the University of Chicago for 11 years. == Books == Wasserstein has written 12 books * The British in Palestine: The Mandatory Government and the Arab-Jewish Conflict 1917–1929 (1978) * Britain and the Jews of Europe, 1939–1945 (1979) * The Jews in Modern France, edited with Frances Malino (1985) * The Secret Lives of Trebitsch Lincoln (1988) * Herbert Samuel: A Political Life (1992) * Vanishing Diaspora: The Jews in Europe since 1945 (1996) * Secret War in Shanghai (1999) * Divided Jerusalem: The Struggle for the Holy City (2001) * Israelis and Palestinians: Why Do They Fight? Can They Stop? (2003) * Barbarism and Civilization: A History of Europe in Our Time (2007) * On the Eve: The Jews of Europe Before the Second World War (2012) * The Ambiguity of Virtue: Gertrude van Tijn and the Fate of the Dutch Jews (2014) Category:American historians Category:Historians from London Category:1948 births Category:University of Chicago faculty
title: Bernard Wasserstein
